info.title: Honcho API
info.summary: The Identity Layer for the Agentic World
info.description: Honcho is a platform for giving agents user-centric memory and social cognition

post.description:
Get a Workspace by ID.

If workspace_id is provided as a query parameter, it uses that (must match JWT workspace_id).
Otherwise, it uses the workspace_id from the JWT.
Get all Workspaces

post.description:
Manually trigger a dream task immediately for a specific collection.

This endpoint bypasses all automatic dream conditions (document threshold,
minimum hours between dreams) and executes the dream task immediately without delay.
Get All Peers for a Workspace

schema.description: Filtering options for the peers list
schema.title: Options

If peer_id is provided as a query parameter, it uses that (must match JWT workspace_id).
Otherwise, it uses the peer_id from the JWT.

200.description: Response to a question informed by Honcho's User Representation

post.description:
Get a peer's working representation for a session.

If a session_id is provided in the body, we get the working representation of the peer in that session.
If a target is provided, we get the representation of the target from the perspective of the peer.
If no target is provided, we get the omniscient Honcho representation of the peer.

schema.description: Options for getting the peer representation

schema.title: Response Get Working Representation V2 Workspaces  Workspace Id  Peers  Peer Id  Representation Post

get.description:
Get a peer card for a specific peer relationship.

Returns the peer card that the observer peer has for the target peer if it exists.
If no target is specified, returns the observer's own peer card.

parameters.name: target

schema.description: The peer whose card to retrieve. If not provided, returns the observer's own card
schema.title: Target

parameters.description: The peer whose card to retrieve. If not provided, returns the observer's own card

put.description:
Set a peer card for a specific peer relationship.

Sets the peer card that the observer peer has for the target peer.
If no target is specified, sets the observer's own peer card.

parameters.name: target

schema.description: The peer whose card to set. If not provided, sets the observer's own card
schema.title: Target

parameters.description: The peer whose card to set. If not provided, sets the observer's own card

get.description:
Get context for a peer, including their representation and peer card.

This endpoint returns the working representation and peer card for a peer.
If a target is specified, returns the context for the target from the
observer peer's perspective. If no target is specified, returns the
peer's own context (self-observation).

This is useful for getting all the context needed about a peer without
making multiple API calls.

parameters.name: target

schema.description: The target peer to get context for. If not provided, returns the peer's own context (self-observation)
schema.title: Target

parameters.description: The target peer to get context for. If not provided, returns the peer's own context (self-observation)

parameters.name: search_query

schema.description: Optional query to curate the representation around semantic search results
schema.title: Search Query

parameters.description: Optional query to curate the representation around semantic search results

parameters.name: search_top_k

schema.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Number of semantic-search-retrieved observations to include
schema.title: Search Top K

parameters.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Number of semantic-search-retrieved observations to include

parameters.name: search_max_distance

schema.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Maximum distance for semantically relevant observations
schema.title: Search Max Distance

parameters.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Maximum distance for semantically relevant observations

parameters.name: include_most_derived

schema.description: Whether to include the most derived observations in the representation
schema.title: Include Most Derived

parameters.description: Whether to include the most derived observations in the representation

parameters.name: max_observations

schema.description: Maximum number of observations to include in the representation

post.description:
Get a specific session in a workspace.

If session_id is provided as a query parameter, it verifies the session is in the workspace.
Otherwise, it uses the session_id from the JWT for verification.
Get All Sessions in a Workspace

schema.description: Filtering and pagination options for the sessions list
schema.title: Options

put.description: Update the metadata of a Session

parameters.name: session_id

schema.description: ID of the session to update
schema.title: Session Id

parameters.description: ID of the session to update

delete.description:
Delete a session and all associated data.

The session is marked as inactive immediately and returns 202 Accepted. The actual
deletion of all related data (messages, embeddings, documents, etc.) happens
asynchronously via the queue with retry support.

This action cannot be undone.

parameters.name: session_id

schema.description: ID of the session to delete
schema.title: Session Id

parameters.description: ID of the session to delete

get.description:
Produce a context object from the session. The caller provides an optional token limit which the entire context must fit into.
If not provided, the context will be exhaustive (within configured max tokens). To do this, we allocate 40% of the token limit
to the summary, and 60% to recent messages -- as many as can fit. Note that the summary will usually take up less space than
this. If the caller does not want a summary, we allocate all the tokens to recent messages.

parameters.name: tokens

schema.description: Number of tokens to use for the context. Includes summary if set to true. Includes representation and peer card if they are included in the response. If not provided, the context will be exhaustive (within 100000 tokens)
schema.title: Tokens

parameters.description: Number of tokens to use for the context. Includes summary if set to true. Includes representation and peer card if they are included in the response. If not provided, the context will be exhaustive (within 100000 tokens)

parameters.name: last_message

schema.description: The most recent message, used to fetch semantically relevant observations
schema.title: Last Message

parameters.description: The most recent message, used to fetch semantically relevant observations

parameters.name: summary

schema.description: Whether or not to include a summary *if* one is available for the session
schema.title: Summary

parameters.description: Whether or not to include a summary *if* one is available for the session

parameters.name: peer_target

schema.description: The target of the perspective. If given without `peer_perspective`, will get the Honcho-level representation and peer card for this peer. If given with `peer_perspective`, will get the representation and card for this peer *from the perspective of that peer*.
schema.title: Peer Target

parameters.description: The target of the perspective. If given without `peer_perspective`, will get the Honcho-level representation and peer card for this peer. If given with `peer_perspective`, will get the representation and card for this peer *from the perspective of that peer*.

parameters.name: peer_perspective

schema.description: A peer to get context for. If given, response will attempt to include representation and card from the perspective of that peer. Must be provided with `peer_target`.
schema.title: Peer Perspective

parameters.description: A peer to get context for. If given, response will attempt to include representation and card from the perspective of that peer. Must be provided with `peer_target`.

parameters.name: limit_to_session

schema.description: Only used if `last_message` is provided. Whether to limit the representation to the session (as opposed to everything known about the target peer)
schema.title: Limit To Session

parameters.description: Only used if `last_message` is provided. Whether to limit the representation to the session (as opposed to everything known about the target peer)

parameters.name: search_top_k

schema.description: Only used if `last_message` is provided. The number of semantic-search-retrieved observations to include in the representation
schema.title: Search Top K

parameters.description: Only used if `last_message` is provided. The number of semantic-search-retrieved observations to include in the representation

parameters.name: search_max_distance

schema.description: Only used if `last_message` is provided. The maximum distance to search for semantically relevant observations
schema.title: Search Max Distance

parameters.description: Only used if `last_message` is provided. The maximum distance to search for semantically relevant observations

parameters.name: include_most_derived

schema.description: Only used if `last_message` is provided. Whether to include the most derived observations in the representation
schema.title: Include Most Derived

parameters.description: Only used if `last_message` is provided. Whether to include the most derived observations in the representation

parameters.name: max_observations

schema.description: Only used if `last_message` is provided. The maximum number of observations to include in the representation
schema.title: Max Observations

parameters.description: Only used if `last_message` is provided. The maximum number of observations to include in the representation

get.description:
Get available summaries for a session.

Returns both short and long summaries if available, including metadata like
the message ID they cover up to, creation timestamp, and token count.

post.description:
Create one or more observations.

Creates observations (theory-of-mind facts) for the specified observer/observed peer pairs.
Each observation must reference existing peers and a session within the workspace.
Embeddings are automatically generated for semantic search.

Maximum of 100 observations per request.

schema.title: Response Create Observations V2 Workspaces  Workspace Id  Observations Post

post.description:
List all observations using custom filters. Observations are listed by recency unless `reverse` is set to `true`.

Observations can be filtered by session_id, observer_id and observed_id using the filters parameter.

parameters.name: reverse

schema.description: Whether to reverse the order of results
schema.title: Reverse

parameters.description: Whether to reverse the order of results

schema.description: Filtering options for the observations list
schema.title: Options

post.description:
Query observations using semantic search.

Performs vector similarity search on observations to find semantically relevant results.
Observer and observed are required for semantic search and must be provided in filters.

schema.title: Response Query Observations V2 Workspaces  Workspace Id  Observations Query Post

delete.description:
Delete a specific observation.

This permanently deletes the observation (document) from the theory-of-mind system.
This action cannot be undone.

parameters.name: observation_id

schema.description: ID of the observation to delete
schema.title: Observation Id

parameters.description: ID of the observation to delete

explicit.title: Explicit
explicit.description: Facts LITERALLY stated by the user - direct quotes or clear paraphrases only, no interpretation or inference. Example: ['The user is 25 years old', 'The user has a dog']

deductive.title: Deductive
deductive.description: Conclusions that MUST be true given explicit facts and premises - strict logical necessities. Each deduction should have premises and a single conclusion.

Representation.title: Representation
Representation.description:
A Representation is a traversable and diffable map of observations.
At the base, we have a list of explicit observations, derived from a peer's messages.

From there, deductive observations can be made by establishing logical relationships between explicit observations.

In the future, we can add more levels of reasoning on top of these.

All of a peer's observations are stored as documents in a collection. These documents can be queried in various ways
to produce this Representation object.

Additionally, a "working representation" is a version of this data structure representing the most recent observations
within a single session.

A representation can have a maximum number of observations, which is applied individually to each level of reasoning.
If a maximum is set, observations are added and removed in FIFO order.

peer_card.description: Configuration for peer card functionality. If deriver is disabled, peer cards will also be disabled and these settings will be ignored.

dream.description: Configuration for dream functionality. If deriver is disabled, dreams will also be disabled and these settings will be ignored.

SessionConfiguration.title: SessionConfiguration
SessionConfiguration.description:
The set of options that can be in a session DB-level configuration dictionary.

All fields are optional. Session-level configuration overrides workspace-level configuration, which overrides global configuration.

peer_representation.description: The peer representation, if context is requested from a specific perspective

peer_card.title: Peer Card
peer_card.description: The peer card, if context is requested from a specific perspective

session_id.title: Session Id
session_id.description: Session ID if filtered by session

pending_work_units.title: Pending Work Units
pending_work_units.description: Work units waiting to be processed

observe_me.title: Observe Me
observe_me.description: Whether honcho should form a global theory-of-mind representation of this peer

observe_others.title: Observe Others
observe_others.description: Whether this peer should form a session-level theory-of-mind representation of other peers in the session

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The public ID of the message that this summary covers up to

summary_type.title: Summary Type
summary_type.description: The type of summary (short or long)

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The timestamp of when the summary was created (ISO format)

token_count.title: Token Count
token_count.description: The number of tokens in the summary text

messages_per_short_summary.title: Messages Per Short Summary
messages_per_short_summary.description: Number of messages per short summary. Must be positive, greater than or equal to 10, and less than messages_per_long_summary.

messages_per_long_summary.title: Messages Per Long Summary
messages_per_long_summary.description: Number of messages per long summary. Must be positive, greater than or equal to 20, and greater than messages_per_short_summary.

observed.title: Observed
observed.description: Observed peer name (defaults to observer if not specified)

peer_card.description: Configuration for peer card functionality. If deriver is disabled, peer cards will also be disabled and these settings will be ignored.

dream.description: Configuration for dream functionality. If deriver is disabled, dreams will also be disabled and these settings will be ignored.

WorkspaceConfiguration.title: WorkspaceConfiguration
WorkspaceConfiguration.description:
The set of options that can be in a workspace DB-level configuration dictionary.

All fields are optional. Session-level configuration overrides workspace-level configuration, which overrides global configuration.
